sentences.english: Stir just until the soup becomes opaque and thickens as the eggs cook, 1 to 2 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 邊攪拌邊慢煮大概一兩分鐘，直到湯變得濃稠。

sentences.english: Lastly bring sauce and spareribs to the boil reducing sauce by half. Serve hot with vegetable rice.
sentences.chinese: 最後把糖醋汁及腩排煮至濃稠，與菜飯同吃。

sentences.english: Remove from heat, then stir in flour, gradually pour in milk and cook until thickened.
sentences.chinese: 離火拌入麪粉，徐徐倒入鮮奶，回爐煮至濃稠。

sentences.english: Rich, thick gravies are either found in restaurants or prepared (rarely) during special occasions.
sentences.chinese: 在餐館或在一些特殊場合纔會有濃稠的肉汁。

sentences.english: If too thin, cook over medium, stirring, until thickened.
sentences.chinese: 如果太稀了，就中火加熱，攪拌，直到變得濃稠。

sentences.english: He filled a jar with thick brown ointment that he had recently compounded.
sentences.chinese: 他給我裝了一罐新配製的濃稠的棕色藥膏。

sentences.english: The most classic is the pork-bone soup, which has a milky consistency.
sentences.chinese: 最受歡迎的是乳白濃稠的豬骨湯。

sentences.english: Thy creamy flesh and hot rind intoxicate me.
sentences.chinese: 你濃稠如脂的肌理和熾熱的膚皮使我沉醉不已。

sentences.english: Cook the sauce in the remaining oil until thickened. Return oysters to the wok and toss well.
sentences.chinese: 用剩餘油把芡汁煮滾至濃稠，把蠔只回鑊，拌勻。

sentences.english: Firm pressure on the lid may express thick secretions.
sentences.chinese: 用力擠壓眼瞼可能會產生濃稠的分泌物。

sentences.english: He says the Mars water might be more like a thick fluid.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲火星上的水可能呈濃稠液體狀。

sentences.english: Boil all seasoning until the sauce thickens.
sentences.chinese: 全部調味料放在煲內，煮至汁液濃稠。

sentences.english: The method was used for determining a component in a simulation liquid mixture with satisfactory results.
sentences.chinese: 方法用於濃稠模擬料液分析，結果令人滿意。

definition: umami, one of the five basic tastes (cookery)
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
lit. just the right flavor/just right/just the thing/excellent
